intro: Gnaphalium lavanduloides, commonly known as silverleaf everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant produces numerous tiny, hairy leaves that give it a silvery appearance. It thrives in dry, sunny conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its compact growth habit and long-lasting flowers make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
